line.comment: * How often THIS evades before rushing regardlessly
* Initiate some variables
* recheck lasers every 15 seconds
* is victim a missile?
* Interrupt ship to start attack and avoid getting slower before reaching its aim
* Check whether THIS is in range and threat of a laser of Aim

line.text: -> get max. number of lasers in turret

line.comment: * Enemy fired: Is fired at THIS?
* forbid the use of missiles
* Enemy fired at THIS and evasion is useful
* evade
* attacked by turret, evade
* Hit by any other laser, evade
* Missile launch routine: launch if not attacked
* Calculate strength of enemy (required for missile selection)
* Launch more missiles if no lasers installed
* Sum of the damage of every incoming missile of Aim: If too great, forbid fire
* returns TRUE if missile launch allowed

line.text: -> get array of missiles aiming to me
-> get ware type code of object

line.comment: * look for strongest missile available and required
* Launch immediately if missile if weaker than 5000

line.text: -> set fire missile time difference to
-> set fire missile time difference to

line.comment: * Launch stronger missiles only if not too many missiles launched at target

line.text: -> set fire missile time difference to

line.comment: * evade to make ship move away from missile so incoming fire doesn't harm the mis.
* Launch huge missiles only if victim is huge (as they're slow) and
* victim is far away (most of the huge missiles have an explosion radius)

line.text: -> set fire missile time difference to

line.comment: * and evade
* THIS is defending atm
* Reduce defendsleft: if it's 0, the ship won't evade for a while
* Missile defence: manage barrage fire
* The array is structured this way:
* 0 - how often has the while-loop been restarted since the array initialisation
* odd - Missile as object
* even - missile's 'Count'
* odd - next missile
* It takes 19 counts (stored in index 0) to remove the missile from the array
* Once they're removed, it's allowed to fire at the missile again
* If missile is attacked, it's restored here'again.
* This way, up to 20 missiles can be attacked simultaneously.
* Get missile
* Get its 'count' (loop in which it has been added)
* Remove missile if destroyed
* remove missile after 19 loop-repetitions
* No missile left in array - remove it
* Get incoming missiles of either THIS or its leader

line.text: -> get array of missiles aiming to me
-> get array of missiles aiming to me

line.comment: * Check the array for missiles to be attacked by the front laser
* Fire at missile if not in Count-Array (explained above)
* Forbid fire for this loop to avoid useless fire code
* Add missile to array or create new one if not created before
* interrupt missile-loop if fired at missile
* Chase missile if too close and dangerous

line.text: -> get ware type code of object

line.comment: * Shieldfactor means how often the ship can be hit by this missile type before
* it dies. Only chase if THIS is no huge ship
* Store old enemy in variable and start attacking the missile
* Fire at victim: Only if Lasers installed and Fire is allowed
* FireReady means waiting 5 while-loops before firing. This avoids missing the
* target and wasting laser energy
* Fire if enemy can't move
* Fire if enemy is a missile
* Get the loop repetitions between two shots. This is required for the next calc.
* Fire if instant-hit-lasers, if first time in range (fire for one second)
* or if closer than 750m
* This formula calculates a possibility with which the lasers are fired.
* It includes the following:
* - Percentage of instant-hit-lasers
* - Distance to enemy
* - Laser-Range
* - loop repetitions between two shots
* - Current Laser Energy
* If the random value is greater than the calculated one, the ship fires.
* Is the calculated value greater than 1000, the ship fires all the time
* Waiting until the victim really is in range of the lasers
* Enemy not in range - reset values
* = wait randomly from 73 to 77 ms
* Restart if the attack target changed
* Chased missile has been destroyed - restart attacking the actual aim
* Find new missile to attack 'missile spam' if no other enemy around

line.text: -> get array of missiles aiming to me
-> get array of missiles aiming to me

line.comment: * Attack if close enough

line.text: -> get ware type code of object

line.comment: * Waiting for a new target to be assigned
* Restart if there's a new target
* Interrupt main script to stop useless movements
* Check whether Script is still required
* Define important values for evasion manoeuvres

sval.val: Advanced Fighting: Task 55: Shoot
How often THIS evades before rushing regardlessly
Initiate some variables
recheck lasers every 15 seconds
is victim a missile?
Interrupt ship to start attack and avoid getting slower before reaching its aim
Check whether THIS is in range and threat of a laser of Aim
Enemy fired: Is fired at THIS?
forbid the use of missiles
Enemy fired at THIS and evasion is useful
attacked by turret, evade
Hit by any other laser, evade
Missile launch routine: launch if not attacked
Calculate strength of enemy (required for missile selection)
Launch more missiles if no lasers installed
Sum of the damage of every incoming missile of Aim: If too great, forbid fire
returns TRUE if missile launch allowed
look for strongest missile available and required
Launch immediately if missile if weaker than 5000
Launch stronger missiles only if not too many missiles launched at target
evade to make ship move away from missile so incoming fire doesn't harm the mis.
Launch huge missiles only if victim is huge (as they're slow) and
victim is far away (most of the huge missiles have an explosion radius)
and evade
THIS is defending atm
Reduce defendsleft: if it's 0, the ship won't evade for a while
Missile defence: manage barrage fire
The array is structured this way
0 - how often has the while-loop been restarted since the array initialisation
odd - Missile as object
even - missile's 'Count'
odd - next missile
It takes 19 counts (stored in index 0) to remove the missile from the array
Once they're removed, it's allowed to fire at the missile again
If missile is attacked, it's restored here'again.
This way, up to 20 missiles can be attacked simultaneously.
Get missile
Get its 'count' (loop in which it has been added)
Remove missile if destroyed
remove missile after 19 loop-repetitions
No missile left in array - remove it
Get incoming missiles of either THIS or its leader
Check the array for missiles to be attacked by the front laser
Fire at missile if not in Count-Array (explained above)
Forbid fire for this loop to avoid useless fire code
Add missile to array or create new one if not created before
interrupt missile-loop if fired at missile
Chase missile if too close and dangerous
Shieldfactor means how often the ship can be hit by this missile type before
it dies. Only chase if THIS is no huge ship
Store old enemy in variable and start attacking the missile
Fire at victim: Only if Lasers installed and Fire is allowed
FireReady means waiting 5 while-loops before firing. This avoids missing the
target and wasting laser energy
Fire if enemy can't move
Fire if enemy is a missile
Get the loop repetitions between two shots. This is required for the next calc.
Fire if instant-hit-lasers, if first time in range (fire for one second)
or if closer than 750m
This formula calculates a possibility with which the lasers are fired.
It includes the following
- Percentage of instant-hit-lasers
- Distance to enemy
- Laser-Range
- loop repetitions between two shots
- Current Laser Energy
If the random value is greater than the calculated one, the ship fires.
Is the calculated value greater than 1000, the ship fires all the time
Waiting until the victim really is in range of the lasers
Enemy not in range - reset values
Restart if the attack target changed
Chased missile has been destroyed - restart attacking the actual aim
Find new missile to attack 'missile spam' if no other enemy around
Attack if close enough
Waiting for a new target to be assigned
Restart if there's a new target
Interrupt main script to stop useless movements
Check whether Script is still required
Define important values for evasion manoeuvres
